timeline.bodyText: Are there any circumstances where a classloader doesn't do this?
timeline.author: garrettjonesgoogle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ permalink: /glossary
 - **Class path**: an ordered list of jar files, zip files, and directories, each of which
   contains Java class files.
   A [class loader](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/ClassLoader.html)
-  typically transforms the fully package qualified name of a Java class
+  transforms the fully package qualified name of a Java class

replies.bodyText:
When it's not invoked, but even if so we don't need that. cf.
"The farmer plows the field"
we don't say, "The farmer typically plows the field" even though there are many other things a farmer does.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: I meant more in the context of the classloader doing stuff. Assuming it does get invoked, does it do something different than this? If not, "typically" shouldn't have ever been there. If so, I'm curious to know (even if it's not put into the content).
replies.author: garrettjonesgoogle

replies.bodyText: It's also going to load the class into the virtual machine, and do various error handling if it doesn't find the file, and so forth.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
Sure, but that's not excluded from the current wording.
Anyway, seems fine to proceed.
replies.author: garrettjonesgoogle
